ANDS-Grants.description: Deaths from heat waves are avoidable. However we still experience such deaths, and it has been predicted that the frequency and intensity of heat waves in Australia will increase due to changes in the climate. It is therefore vital that our communities are prepared in times of extreme heat. Strengthening the ways that heatwave plans are implemented at a community level is an important way of increasing our ability to cope with such natural hazards, and also strengthens community resilience.
ANDS-Grants.title: TRIP Bowen
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
subjects: public health | climate change adaption | health services research | implementation | heat stress
